questions.title: How do you forecast and plan for demand increases due to seasonality or peak events?
questions.description: Forecasting and planning is essential to achieving your operational objectives and supporting your business goals.

choices.title: Analyze and predict contact volume increases based on historical data.

helpfulResource.displayText: Forecasting is the starting point for any scheduling and capacity planning activities. Analyze historical contact data help predict future contact volume and the resources needed to handle that volume.

improvementPlan.displayText: Consider implementing Amazon Connect forecasting, capacity planning, and scheduling or similar solutions to help you optimize your contact center.

choices.title: Generate staffing needs from historical service level goals and metrics.

helpfulResource.displayText: Contact center schedulers or managers need to create agent schedules to support high volume workloads that are flexible and meet business and compliance requirements.

improvementPlan.displayText: Consider implementing Amazon Connect forecasting, capacity planning, and scheduling or similar solutions to help you optimize your contact center. Amazon Connect helps you create efficient schedules that are optimized for per-channel Service Level or Average speed of answer targets.

questions.title: How do you ensure production capacity will meet changing demand during peak events?
questions.description: Use capacity planning and scaling management mechanisms to validate your application is scaled to support your peak traffic before the event.

choices.title: Validate Amazon Connect service quotas are set at a level to meet the forecasted demand.

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect has default quotas, formerly referred to as limits, for each of its features. All service quotas can be adjusted/increased unless otherwise noted.

improvementPlan.displayText: Review the default service quotas for each feature of Amazon Connect and request increases where applicable. When requesting an increase for Amazon Connect, be sure to use expected values without additional padding for fluctuations.

choices.title: Understand current Amazon Connect API throttling quotas.

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect throttling quotas are by account, and per Region, not by user and not by instance. When you use the Amazon Connect Service API , the number of requests per second is limited depending on the API.

improvementPlan.displayText: Ensure API throttling quotas are considered when using Amazon Connect Service APIs.

choices.title: Provide adequate lead time for quota limit increases.

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect service quotas apply per Region. For example, you can have 2 Amazon Connect instances in each Region. It can take up to a few weeks to increase your service quota. If you're increasing your quotas as part of a larger project, be sure to add this time to your plan.

improvementPlan.displayText: Review the default service quotas for each service involved in your workload as well as the default service quotas for Amazon Connect and request increases where applicable. When requesting an increase for Amazon Connect, be sure to use expected values without additional padding for fluctuations.

choices.title: Ensure carrier diversity for international toll-free and high-concurrency DIDs.

helpfulResource.displayText: If you are using an existing toll-free national service to redirect inbound traffic to DIDs, you should request DID phone numbers across multiple telephony providers. A general recommendation for this configuration is 100 sessions per-DID and your AWS Solutions Architect can help with capacity calculations and setup.

improvementPlan.displayText: If you are using an existing toll-free national service to redirect inbound traffic to DIDs, you should request DID phone numbers across multiple telephony providers. A general recommendation for this configuration is 100 sessions per-DID and your AWS Solutions Architect can help with capacity calculations and setup.

choices.title: Perform capacity planning and validation on integrated systems and dependencies.

helpfulResource.displayText: Ensure integrated AWS service, such as AWS Lambda and Amazon Lex, have undergone capacity planning and validation in similar fashion as Amazon Connect.

improvementPlan.displayText: Perform capacity planning and validation on integrated systems and dependencies.

choices.title: Schedule and perform load testing on business critical production systems.

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect regularly executes rigorous testing to ensure our system delivers the security, reliability, and availability required to support world class contact centers of all sizes. While Amazon Connect is able to sustain high levels of load, customers should also perform load tests of their unique use cases, configurations, networks, BPOs, etc.

improvementPlan.displayText: Contact AWS at least two weeks before the desired load or stress tests date. Complete a Amazon Connect Load Test Request intake form, which can be obtained by sending an email to Amazon-Connect-Load-Test-Requests@amazon.com.

questions.title: How do you know you are ready to support your peak event?
questions.description: Evaluate the operational readiness of your workload, processes and procedures, and personnel as you prepare for peak.

choices.title: Ensure consistent review of operational readiness.

helpfulResource.displayText: Use Operational Readiness Reviews (ORRs) to validate that you can operate your workload.

improvementPlan.displayText: Run ORRs before a workload launches to general availability and then throughout the software development lifecycle. Reviews must include, at a minimum, the operational readiness of the teams and the workload, and security requirements. Implement review activities in code and trigger automated review in response to events where appropriate, to ensure consistency, speed of execution, and reduce errors caused by manual processes.

choices.title: Real-time monitoring of contact center metrics and alerts have been updated with forecasting thresholds.

helpfulResource.displayText: Establish patterns of workload activity to identify anomalous behavior so that you can respond appropriately if required.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement a mechanism to periodically check the health of your system to answer questions like are customers able to dial the phone # or its giving busy signal, how is system utilization against the service limit etc.

choices.title: Ensure support personal availability and capability is adequate to support your peak event.

helpfulResource.displayText: Support personnel should have access to all services in use to support your workload.

improvementPlan.displayText: Have a mechanism to validate that you have the appropriate number of trained personnel to provide support for operational needs. Train personnel and adjust personnel capacity as necessary to maintain effective support.

choices.title: Ensure event logging management systems are scaled to support additional load.

helpfulResource.displayText: Monitoring is important for maintaining the reliability, availability, and performance of your contact center. You should collect monitoring data from all of the parts of your AWS solution so that you can more easily debug a multi-point failure if one occurs.

improvementPlan.displayText: Perform regular proactive reviews of metrics to identify trends and determine where appropriate responses are needed. See the following topics to learn how to use Amazon CloudWatch Logs and AWS CloudTrail to monitor Amazon Connect and describes the Amazon Connect metrics sent to CloudWatch.

questions.title: How do you respond to anomalies?
questions.description: Prepare and validate procedures for responding to events to minimize their disruption to your contact center.

choices.title: Use a process for event, incident, and problem management.

helpfulResource.displayText: When incidents and problems happen to your workload, you need processes to handle them. Processes must be documented in a central location and available to anyone involved in your workload. If you don't have a central wiki or document store, a version control repository can be used. You'll keep these plans up to date as your processes evolve.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement a process to handle events, incidents, and problems. These processes are documented and stored in a central location. They are updated as processes change.

choices.title: Define support escalation paths.

helpfulResource.displayText: Identify owners for each action to ensure effective and prompt responses to operations events. Identify when a human decision is required before an action is taken. Work with decision makers to have that decision made in advance, and the action pre-approved, so that Mean-Time-to-Resolution (MTTR) is not extended waiting for a response.

improvementPlan.displayText: Define escalation paths in your run books and playbooks, including what triggers escalation, and procedures for escalation. Identify owners for each action to ensure effective and prompt responses to operations events.

choices.title: Automate responses to events.

helpfulResource.displayText: Automate the communication with your users (for example, with email or SMS) when the services they use are impacted, and again when the services return to normal operating conditions, to enable users to take appropriate action.

improvementPlan.displayText: Automate responses to events to reduce errors caused by manual processes, and to ensure prompt and consistent responses.

questions.title: How do you respond to API resource constraints?
questions.description: Amazon Connect throttling quotas are by account, are not per instance. Ensure usage of service APIs follow best practices to respond appropriately to throttle events.

choices.title: Implement a caching/queuing solution.

helpfulResource.displayText: To decrease API data query overhead and avoid throttling, you can use an intermediary database like Amazon DynamoDB to store API call results rather than calling the API from all endpoints interested in the API data.

improvementPlan.displayText: Rather than having separate AWS Lambda functions, each with their own polling requirements, you can have a single AWS Lambda function write all interesting data to Amazon DynamoDB. Rather than having each endpoint go to the API directly to retrieve the data, they point to DynamoDB.

choices.title: Ensure exponential back off and retry strategies are in place.

helpfulResource.displayText: You can run into situations where API throttling limits get exceeded. This can happen when the API calls fail and are retried repeatedly or made directly from multiple concurrent endpoints without a caching or queuing solution implemented. To avoid exceeding your service quotas and impacting downstream processes, you should consider using exponential back off and retry strategies within your AWS Lambda functions in combination with caching and queueing.

improvementPlan.displayText: Consider using exponential back off and retry strategies within your AWS Lambda functions in combination with caching and queueing to assist in avoiding exceeding service quotas.

questions.title: How do you ensure path to service for your contacts?
questions.description: Design your contact flows to ensure contacts are handled or receive relative information on why the contact cannot be routed.

choices.title: Ensure consistent routing profiles coverage.

helpfulResource.displayText: Understanding how priority, delay, and overflow routing work within Amazon Connect is critical to maximizing agent productivity, reducing contact wait times, and ensuring the best quality of experience for your contacts.

improvementPlan.displayText: Understanding how priority, delay, and overflow routing work within Amazon Connect is critical to maximizing agent productivity, reducing contact wait times, and ensuring the best quality of experience for your contacts.

choices.title: Implement tiered routing.

helpfulResource.displayText: Contact routing in Amazon Connect is done through a collection of queues and routing configurations called a routing profile.

improvementPlan.displayText: Within your contact flow, you can prompt for additional information and, if they need to reach an agent, you can use the contact flow configuration to place them in the appropriate queue.

choices.title: Offer queued callbacks.

helpfulResource.displayText: You can create contact flows that provide the ability for customers to leave their phone number and get a callback from an agent rather than remaining on the contact and waiting for the next available agent.

improvementPlan.displayText: Evaluate offering queued callbacks to give the customer the ability to leave a phone number and get called back rather than remaining on the phone.

choices.title: Offer alternate contact channels.

helpfulResource.displayText: Agents can handle voice, chat, and tasks in Amazon Connect. Web and mobile chat enables customer to build chatting features into your website to enable self-service and engage your agents over chat.

improvementPlan.displayText: Offer alternate contact channels, such as chat or tasks, in addition to voice.

questions.title: How do you dynamically adapt to emergency conditions?
questions.description: Design your contact flows to ensure proper prompting for out-of-office conditions and other contact error events.

choices.title: Use flexible ingress points.
Implement look ahead checks for operating hours and queue status.

helpfulResource.displayText: There are many planned and unplanned events that can impact the customer experience as they traverse through Amazon Connect contact flows. Standard look-ahead checks typically include holiday, business hours, and staffing checks.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement look ahead checks for operating hours, queue status, and staffing.

choices.title: Implement emergency routing mechanisms.

helpfulResource.displayText: Incorporating a mechanism to set an emergency flag in one (or many) contact flows can ensure business continuity and mitigate the impact of disaster situations from affecting your customers.

improvementPlan.displayText: Consider building an AWS API gateway with AWS Lambda function at the back end to set the Emergency flag to true/false securely in the database. Your supervisors can securely access that API through web to toggle disaster mode or dynamically toggle it in response to an external event.
